intro: Spiloxene serrata var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and serrated, giving the plant its species name "serrata." It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. The variety albiflora is distinguished by its notably white floral coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties of Spiloxene serrata.
